channel.title: Help Compiling Client
channel.description:
Please, don't put me down if this is the wrong section, but I think it is the right place for it.
When I try to compile my client I'm working on with the "perfect compiler" I always get this
[IMG]http://i45.photobucket.com/albums/f86/maticus_06/help1.jpg[/img]
But I have JDK, [IMG]http://i45.photobucket.com/albums/f86/maticus_06/help2.jpg[/img]
Do any of you know what I need to do to fix this?

item.title: Help Compiling Client
item.dc:creator: @Imnotokkk Imnotokkk
item.description:
@Imnotokkk wrote:

[quote=“Maticus, post:5, topic:251279”]I’ve tried to use a lot of clients and I always get this,

Anyone know of a good base client for a 317?[/quote]
^means you messed up. Go back and try to fix what you messed up.

@echo off Title Xile-Scape <<< You can Change That... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
this will work for your compiler

Read full topic

item.title: Help Compiling Client
item.dc:creator: @Maticus Maticus
item.description:
@Maticus wrote:

I still get 5 errors and noe of the changes I made are apparent so I think I just need a different base client, any suggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: Help Compiling Client
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

@echo off
if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (%p% -cp . sign/signlink.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
"%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

That’s it, actually.
The signlink needs to be compiled, too, so I’ve edited it to do that.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Compiling Client
item.dc:creator: @Xile_Maizez Xile Maizez
item.description:
@Xile_Maizez wrote:

…The compiler I gave you was for a Server LOL… Here’s one for a client:

@echo off
if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
"%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Try that. MAKE SURE you have JDK 1.6.0_11

I have 2 clients at the moment, and that compiler works for both.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

There’s nothing wrong with his compiler, he just doesn’t have the signlink class in the sign package.

item.title: Help Compiling Client
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Xile Maizez:

You dont have JDK 1.6.0_11

I’m familiar with Taharok’s old compiler. It isn’t made to support later updates than about 6.3.

@OP: Try the one that Xile Maizez posted.
Make sure you download the latest version of JDK first.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Compiling Client
item.dc:creator: @Xile_Maizez Xile Maizez
item.description:
@Xile_Maizez wrote:

You dont have JDK 1.6.0_11
Go to http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
There’s a link there saying
“Get the JDK Download”
Click it and select “Windows” and “Multi Language”
Then try compiling again, if it doesn’t work then use this compiler:

@echo off
Title Xile-Scape <<< You can Change That...
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

GL.

Read full topic
